definition: vast, with no clear boundary/fig. hazy/indistinct/unclear/confused
vast, with no clear boundary/fig. hazy/indistinct/unclear/confused
(of mist, snow, floodwater etc) a vast expanse of whiteness

sentences.english: He overlooked the land, which was still a vast expanse of whiteness.
sentences.chinese: 他忽略了土地，这仍然是一个白茫茫。

sentences.english: The plane could get through the edge less snow-plain without difficult.
sentences.chinese: 飞机能够毫无困难地飞越这一望无际的茫茫雪原。

sentences.english: An old man, a shabby boat and a vast sea.
sentences.chinese: 一个老人，一只破旧的船与一片茫茫大海。

sentences.english: When I search for him all I see is snow.
sentences.chinese: 我搜寻他，却只看到茫茫白雪。

sentences.english: It's just a piece of cake for a plane to fly over the vast snowfield.
sentences.chinese: 飞机能够毫无困难地飞越这一望无际的茫茫雪原。

sentences.english: In this ocean, and I am only a very small drop of water.
sentences.chinese: 在这茫茫大海之中，我只是很小的一滴水。

sentences.english: And the universe outside our solar system seems to abound with potential homes.
sentences.chinese: 太阳系外茫茫宇宙之中，似乎充满了可能的生命家园。

sentences.english: From the top to the hill on the island we could see the blue sea on every hand.
sentences.chinese: 从岛上的山顶我们可以望见四处是茫茫碧海。

sentences.english: Afar, it offered a pale blank of mist and cloud;
sentences.chinese: 远处，呈现的是一片白茫茫的云雾。

sentences.english: In vacant or in pensive mood.
As a sheet of snow covers the forgotten world.
sentences.chinese: 当茫茫白雪铺下遗忘的世界。

sentences.english: The camels rolled in the white dust, raising puffs of cloud.
sentences.chinese: 骆驼在白茫茫的沙里打滚，扬起阵阵尘雾。

sentences.english: An hour's journey brought us to a green grassland, which ran down to the distant horizon.
sentences.chinese: 旅程把我们带到了一片茫茫无际的绿色草原上。

sentences.english: Flickering high- rise, boundless and indistinct sea of faces, where be the ground of my stay?
sentences.chinese: 幢幢高楼，茫茫人海，哪里是我的栖身之地？

definition: (of mist, snow, floodwater etc) a vast expanse of whiteness
as far as the eye can see (idiom)
to stretch as far as the eye can see (idiom)
